text: <a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-1/" title="Song of Solomon 6:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-2/" title="Song of Solomon 6:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-3/" title="Song of Solomon 6:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 I *am* my beloved's, and my beloved *is* mine: he feedeth among the lilies.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-4/" title="Song of Solomon 6:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Thou *art* beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as *an army* with banners.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-5/" title="Song of Solomon 6:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair *is* as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-6/" title="Song of Solomon 6:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Thy teeth *are* as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and *there is* not one barren among them.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-7/" title="Song of Solomon 6:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 As a piece of a pomegranate *are* thy temples within thy locks.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-8/" title="Song of Solomon 6:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-9/" title="Song of Solomon 6:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 My dove, my undefiled is *but* one; she *is* the *only* one of her mother, she *is* the choice *one* of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; *yea*, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-10/" title="Song of Solomon 6:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Who *is* she *that* looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, *and* terrible as *an army* with banners?

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-11/" title="Song of Solomon 6:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, *and* to see whether the vine flourished, *and* the pomegranates budded.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-12/" title="Song of Solomon 6:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Or ever I was aware, my soul made me *like* the chariots of Amminadib.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-6-13/" title="Song of Solomon 6:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
